title: HoloEv-Net: Efficient Event-based Action Recognition via Holographic Spatial Embedding and Global Spectral Gating
summary: Event-based Action Recognition (EAR) has attracted significant attention due to the high temporal resolution and high dynamic range of event cameras. However, existing methods typically suffer from (i) the computational redundancy of dense voxel representations, (ii) structural redundancy inherent in multi-branch architectures, and (iii) the under-utilization of spectral information in capturing global motion patterns. To address these challenges, we propose an efficient EAR framework named HoloEv-Net. First, to simultaneously tackle representation and structural redundancies, we introduce a Compact Holographic Spatiotemporal Representation (CHSR). Departing from computationally expensive voxel grids, CHSR implicitly embeds horizontal spatial cues into the Time-Height (T-H) view, effectively preserving 3D spatiotemporal contexts within a 2D representation. Second, to exploit the neglected spectral cues, we design a Global Spectral Gating (GSG) module. By leveraging the Fast Fourier Transform (FFT) for global token mixing in the frequency domain, GSG enhances the representation capability with negligible parameter overhead. Extensive experiments demonstrate the scalability and effectiveness of our framework. Specifically, HoloEv-Net-Base achieves state-of-the-art performance on THU-EACT-50-CHL, HARDVS and DailyDVS-200, outperforming existing methods by 10.29%, 1.71% and 6.25%, respectively. Furthermore, our lightweight variant, HoloEv-Net-Small, delivers highly competitive accuracy while offering extreme efficiency, reducing parameters by 5.4 times, FLOPs by 300times, and latency by 2.4times compared to heavy baselines, demonstrating its potential for edge deployment.

AI.tldr: 本文提出HoloEv-Net，一种高效的事件驱动动作识别框架，通过紧凑全息时空表示和全局谱门控模块，解决了现有方法在计算冗余、结构冗余和谱信息利用不足方面的挑战。
AI.motivation: 现有事件驱动动作识别方法存在三个主要问题：密集体素表示导致计算冗余，多分支架构存在结构冗余，以及谱信息在捕捉全局运动模式时利用不足，限制了方法的效率和性能。
AI.method: 提出紧凑全息时空表示将水平空间线索隐式嵌入时间-高度视图，在2D表示中保留3D时空上下文；设计全局谱门控模块利用快速傅里叶变换在频域进行全局令牌混合，以极小的参数开销增强表示能力。
AI.result: HoloEv-Net-Base在THU-EACT-50-CHL、HARDVS和DailyDVS-200数据集上分别以10.29%、1.71%和6.25%的优势超越现有方法；轻量级变体HoloEv-Net-Small在保持竞争力的同时，参数量减少5.4倍，计算量减少300倍，延迟降低2.4倍。
AI.conclusion: 该研究证明了通过紧凑表示和谱域处理可以显著提升事件驱动动作识别的效率和性能，轻量级变体展示了边缘部署的潜力，为高效事件视觉系统设计提供了新思路。

title: PEPR: Privileged Event-based Predictive Regularization for Domain Generalization
summary: Deep neural networks for visual perception are highly susceptible to domain shift, which poses a critical challenge for real-world deployment under conditions that differ from the training data. To address this domain generalization challenge, we propose a cross-modal framework under the learning using privileged information (LUPI) paradigm for training a robust, single-modality RGB model. We leverage event cameras as a source of privileged information, available only during training. The two modalities exhibit complementary characteristics: the RGB stream is semantically dense but domain-dependent, whereas the event stream is sparse yet more domain-invariant. Direct feature alignment between them is therefore suboptimal, as it forces the RGB encoder to mimic the sparse event representation, thereby losing semantic detail. To overcome this, we introduce Privileged Event-based Predictive Regularization (PEPR), which reframes LUPI as a predictive problem in a shared latent space. Instead of enforcing direct cross-modal alignment, we train the RGB encoder with PEPR to predict event-based latent features, distilling robustness without sacrificing semantic richness. The resulting standalone RGB model consistently improves robustness to day-to-night and other domain shifts, outperforming alignment-based baselines across object detection and semantic segmentation.

AI.tldr: 该研究提出了一种基于特权事件预测正则化（PEPR）的跨模态框架，用于训练鲁棒的单一模态RGB模型，通过利用仅在训练时可用的事件相机作为特权信息，解决视觉感知模型在领域泛化方面的挑战。
AI.motivation: 深度视觉感知网络对领域偏移高度敏感，这在实际部署中构成关键挑战，因为现实条件往往与训练数据存在差异。该研究旨在解决领域泛化问题，通过利用学习使用特权信息（LUPI）范式，在训练期间利用事件相机作为特权信息源，以增强单一模态RGB模型的鲁棒性。
AI.method: 该研究提出特权事件预测正则化（PEPR）框架，将LUPI重新构建为共享潜在空间中的预测问题。该方法避免直接跨模态特征对齐，而是训练RGB编码器预测基于事件的潜在特征，从而在不牺牲语义丰富性的情况下提取鲁棒性。两种模态具有互补特性：RGB流语义密集但领域依赖，事件流稀疏但更领域不变。
AI.result: 所提出的独立RGB模型在昼夜转换及其他领域偏移条件下展现出持续改进的鲁棒性。在目标检测和语义分割任务中，该方法均优于基于对齐的基线方法，证明了PEPR框架在领域泛化方面的有效性。
AI.conclusion: 该研究表明，通过将特权信息学习重新构建为预测问题而非直接特征对齐，可以在保持语义丰富性的同时有效提取领域不变性。这一框架为利用多模态数据增强单一模态模型的鲁棒性提供了新思路，对实际部署中应对领域偏移具有重要价值。

title: Real-time processing of analog signals on accelerated neuromorphic hardware
summary: Sensory processing with neuromorphic systems is typically done by using either event-based sensors or translating input signals to spikes before presenting them to the neuromorphic processor. Here, we offer an alternative approach: direct analog signal injection eliminates superfluous and power-intensive analog-to-digital and digital-to-analog conversions, making it particularly suitable for efficient near-sensor processing. We demonstrate this by using the accelerated BrainScaleS-2 mixed-signal neuromorphic research platform and interfacing it directly to microphones and a servo-motor-driven actuator. Utilizing BrainScaleS-2's 1000-fold acceleration factor, we employ a spiking neural network to transform interaural time differences into a spatial code and thereby predict the location of sound sources. Our primary contributions are the first demonstrations of direct, continuous-valued sensor data injection into the analog compute units of the BrainScaleS-2 ASIC, and actuator control using its embedded microprocessors. This enables a fully on-chip processing pipeline$\unicode{x2014}$from sensory input handling, via spiking neural network processing to physical action. We showcase this by programming the system to localize and align a servo motor with the spatial direction of transient noise peaks in real-time.

AI.tldr: 该研究提出了一种直接模拟信号注入方法，用于神经形态系统，消除了传统信号转换中的功率密集型模数/数模转换，实现了从传感器输入到物理动作的完全片上处理管道，并在BrainScaleS-2平台上展示了实时声源定位与伺服电机对准的应用。
AI.motivation: 传统神经形态系统通常使用事件传感器或将输入信号转换为脉冲，这涉及功率密集型的模数/数模转换过程。本研究旨在解决这一效率问题，通过直接模拟信号注入方法，为近传感器处理提供更高效的替代方案，特别适用于需要实时处理的嵌入式应用场景。
AI.method: 本研究采用BrainScaleS-2混合信号神经形态研究平台，实现了直接模拟信号注入技术，将麦克风信号直接输入到平台的模拟计算单元中。利用脉冲神经网络将双耳时间差转换为空间编码，并通过嵌入式微处理器控制伺服电机执行器，构建了从传感器输入到物理动作的完整片上处理管道。
AI.result: 研究成功展示了直接连续值传感器数据注入BrainScaleS-2 ASIC模拟计算单元的首个演示，以及使用其嵌入式微处理器进行执行器控制。系统能够实时定位瞬态噪声峰值的空间方向，并控制伺服电机对准声源方向，充分利用了平台1000倍的加速因子优势。
AI.conclusion: 该研究证明了直接模拟信号注入方法的可行性和效率优势，为神经形态计算系统提供了更节能的传感器接口方案。完全片上处理管道的实现展示了神经形态硬件在实时嵌入式应用中的潜力，为未来高效近传感器处理系统的发展提供了重要技术路径。
